titlestmt.titleproper: Solon, Ohio. Solon Community Church records, 1897-2022.
titlestmt.author: Madison Bellew

maintenanceevent.eventdescription: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday May 15, 2025 at 15:33

did.unittitle: Solon, Ohio. Solon Community Church records, 1897-2022.
did.abstract: The Solon Community Church was founded in 1834 as a congregational fellowship before joining the Cleveland Presbytery in 1840. The church burned down in 1897 and held services at the schoolhouse and Disciples of Christ church until a new building was dedicated in 1898. The Solon Presbyterian and Disciples churches joined to form the Solon Federated Church in 1922 which changed its name to the Solon Community Church in 1948, and which split apart in 1951. In 1955, the church rejoined the congregational denomination by joining the Congregational Christian Conference and later the United Church of Christ in 1961. To keep up with the growing city, a new church was built in 1960 with various renovations occurring in the following years. Due to declining membership, the Solon Community Church permanently closed in 2022 with the last service held in November of that year. This collection includes records documenting the history, activities, and members of the Solon Community Church through meeting minutes, reports, financial and legal records, member records, newsletters, photographs, church histories, programs, and pamphlets.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is unrestricted and open to the public.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Items in this collection are subject to U.S. Copyright Law. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine the copyright status of collection items and to secure any permissions necessary for their reproduction and publication. Requests for permission to publish material must be discussed with the archivist or librarian.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], in the Solon, Ohio. Solon Community Church records, 1897-2022, RG5460. The Congregational Library & Archives, Boston, MA.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were donated to the Congregational Library & Archives by Solon Community Church in May 2023 and June 2024; 2023-32 and 2024-20.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Madison Bellew, May 2025, using DACS.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Solon Community Church was founded in 1834 in Solon, Ohio, as a "fellowship of Christians in a Congregational manner" by a group of men led by Rev. John Steward. In 1836, a church building was raised and dedicated, and the first minister was called. Due to financial difficulties in the first decade, the church was unable to be self-supporting and in 1840, it was taken under the care of the Cleveland Presbytery and their Home Missions Board. The church became fully Presbyterian in 1871. In 1841, some families within the church separated to found the Disciples of Christ church nearby. In 1853, the church enlarged their meeting house and in 1897, the church building burned to the ground. While the new building was being built, the congregation held services in the schoolhouse and the Disciple church which later burned down in 1899. The new church building broke ground in 1897, laid the cornerstone in September 1897 and was dedicated in January 1898.

In 1922, the Solon Presbyterian church and the Disciple church formed a federation to become the Solon Federated Church with services alternating between the two church buildings until eventually the entirety of services were held in the Presbyterian church. In 1924, a parsonage was built next to the Presbyterian church. Since the church served the entire Protestant community in Solon, the church changed its name to the Solon Community Church in 1948. Shortly after, in 1951, some of the members of the Disciple church decided to reform their own church and refurbished their church building which became the Pioneer Memorial Church in 1953. Also in 1953, Solon Community Church was forced to buy back their building and parsonage from the Cleveland Presbytery after a court trial regarding the question of ownership. In 1955, the church returned to the congregational denomination by joining the Congregational Christian Conference and in 1961, joined the United Church of Christ formed from the merger of the Congregational Christian and Evangelical and Reformed churches.

To keep up with the growth of Solon, the church purchased land in 1957 for a new building and broke ground in 1960 with the cornerstone laid in September 1960, and a dedication in April 1961. In 1962, a parsonage was purchased on Linden Dr. and was later replaced by a parsonage on Copley Ave in 1972. The Copley Ave parsonage was sold in 1983 to the then minister Rev. Mark Thomas. Over the years, various renovations and building improvements occurred, notably in 1975, 1995-1997, 2003 with the new Congregational Life Center which was dedicated in January 2006, and 2007. As the church entered the 2020s, membership declined until the church decided to permanently close in 2022 with the last service held in November 2022.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains records documenting the history, activities and members of Solon Community Church in Solon, Ohio. The records include council meeting minutes, board meeting minutes, annual reports, financial records, legal records, site plans, membership cards, church registers, vital statistics, service programs, pamphlets, brochures, photographs, photo slides, church histories, and newsletters.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged into six series, three of which have been further arranged into subseries. Materials have been arranged chronologically by start date within the series and subseries with materials of similar topics grouped together.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Additional records related to the history of Solon Community Church prior to 1955 when it was a Presbyterian church can be found at the Presbyterian Historical Society in Solon Community Church (Solon, Ohio) records, accession number 23 0614.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains the records of the Solon Community Church council including meeting minutes from the council, some meeting minutes from the church boards, supporting documents relating to the council, and records from the council's executive committee.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records from various church boards and groups including meeting minutes, correspondence, reports, member lists, brochures, pamphlets, cards, ledgers, and other documents relating to the work of the boards.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records from the Board of Trustees, formerly known as the Executive Board prior to 1948 when the Solon Community Church split from the Solon Federated Church. The series contains meeting minutes, annual reports, budgets, rental agreements, contracts, and other documents relating to the trustees.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records from the board of benevolence including meeting minutes, budgets, and other records relating to the board.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records from the board of deacons, also known as the diaconate, including meeting minutes and supporting documents from their meetings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records from the Women's Fellowship group including meeting minutes, thank you notes, constitutions, pamphlets, and other documents relating to the fellowship.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records from the Board of Elders including meeting minutes, member lists, and other documents relating to the board.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records from the Board of Christian Education including meeting minutes, member lists, booklets, job descriptions, budgets, and other documents relating to christian education.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records from the Ladies Auxiliary group including meeting minutes and related documents in two ledgers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records from the monthly all boards meetings which occasionally overlapped with the church council meetings. The series includes meeting minutes and documents related to the meetings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records from the Rebecca Circle, one of the women's circles, and includes meeting minutes, financial reports, and other documents relating to the circle.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records from the Naomi Circle, one of the women's circles, and includes meeting minutes and other documents from the circle.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records from the Esther Circle, one of the women's circles, which was formerly known as the Big Sisters group until October 1960. The series includes meeting minutes, and other documents relating to the circle.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records from the King's Men Fellowship and includes constitutions and correspondence.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records from the Board of Stewards and includes meeting minutes, annual reports, financial reports, and other documents relating to the board.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains vital statistic records relating to the members of Solon Community Church. The series contains membership cards, two church registers, member directories, member transfer records, marriage certificates and records, baptismal records, and member and officer lists.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records relating to the administration of Solon Community Church. The series includes legal records, financial records, employment documents, congregational meeting minutes, annual reports, committee records, inventories, renovation and property records, site plans, constitutions, and attendance records.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains annual reports for the church.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records about renovations done at Solon Community Church and includes site plans, budgets, meeting minutes, canvass records, pamphlets, correspondence, and other documents related to the renovations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records about the history of the Solon Community Church, formerly the Solon Federated Church. The series contains written histories, church services, photos, news articles, organizational outlines, brochures, obituaries, funeral booklets. and records and correspondence relating to special events or services.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains photos depicting the church and its members, and includes polaroids, photo slides, and photographs. Some of the photos are undated.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains the church newsletter, "The Light", which was printed on a regular weekly, monthly, or seasonal basis depending on the year. The years 1966-1980 are missing from the collection.
